summary: Email correspondence between defense attorney Bruce Barket and a federal prosecutor regarding scheduling a status conference for defendant Nicholas Tartaglione. Barket informs the prosecutor that his trial schedule has changed and inquires if the government needs more time to review materials, suggesting a possible adjournment.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney representing Nicholas Tartaglione, corresponding with a federal prosecutor about scheduling a status conference and a Curcio issue.

persons.name: Margery
persons.context: Assistant U.S. Attorney corresponding with Bruce Barket, indicating she will provide an update the following day regarding the status conference.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Client of Bruce Barket, subject of an upcoming status conference in his case.

persons.name: Judge Karas
persons.context: Judge mentioned by Bruce Barket as someone he might ask for help regarding the scheduling issue.

connections.description: Bruce Barket is the defense attorney representing Nicholas Tartaglione in his legal proceedings.
Professional correspondence between defense attorney and federal prosecutor regarding case scheduling.

events.title: Bruce Barket's Trial Rescheduled
events.description: Bruce Barket's trial, originally scheduled for February 24, 2020, was moved to March 3, 2020.

events.title: Original Trial Date for Barket
events.description: Bruce Barket's trial was originally supposed to begin on this date.

events.title: Email Correspondence Regarding Tartaglione Status Conference
events.description: Email exchange between Bruce Barket and prosecutor Margery discussing the scheduling of a status conference for Nicholas Tartaglione and a Curcio issue.

locations: 666 Old Country Road, Ste. 700, Garden City, NY 11530
keyFacts: Bruce Barket, a defense attorney, was representing Nicholas Tartaglione in a case involving a Curcio issue (related to potential conflicts of interest in legal representation).
Barket's own trial schedule conflict prompted him to contact the prosecutor to discuss potentially adjourning Tartaglione's status conference.
The email reveals ongoing legal proceedings and scheduling coordination between defense and prosecution in the Tartaglione case in early 2020.
The correspondence shows professional communication between defense counsel (Barket) and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding case management.
